case_vignette: A 60-YEAR-OLD MAN PRESENTS WITH RAPIDLY GROWING LESIONS ON HIS FACE, TRUNK, AXILLAE, FLEXURAL AREAS, AND GROIN. THE LESIONS APPEARED 3 MONTHS EARLIER IN HIS PERIANAL AREA AND EXTENDED RAPIDLY TO OTHER AREAS. PREVIOUSLY, HE WAS TREATED WITH TOPICAL AGENTS FOR ATOPIC DERMATITIS AND SEBORRHEIC DERMATITIS WITHOUT IMPROVEMENT. EXAMINATION REVEALS DISSEMINATED VIOLACEOUS PAPULES AND PLAQUES ON THE FACE, TRUNK, AXILLAE, AND PERIANAL AREA; SOME LESIONS WERE CONFLUENT AND ULCERATED. YELLOWISH-RED TO SKIN-COLORED PAPULES ARE PRESENT ON THE SCALP. HE HAS NO PALPABLE LYMPHADENOPATHY OR ORGANOMEGALY.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rapidly growing spots on my face, body, and some personal areas that started small around my perianal area and have spread to other parts of my body.
When did you first notice these spots?
I first noticed these spots around 3 months ago.
Do the spots have a particular color, or are there changes in the texture of the skin surface where they appear?
Yes, the spots are violaceous (purple-like) and some are yellowish-red to skin-colored, especially on my scalp; some of the larger spots have become confluent and even ulcerated.
Have you experienced any other symptoms such as fever, weight loss, night sweats, or fatigue recently?
No, I have not experienced any of those symptoms.
Do you have any history of similar skin issues in your family?
No, I do not have any family history of similar skin issues.
Do you have any underlying health conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
I was previously treated with topical agents for skin conditions like atopic dermatitis and seborrheic dermatitis, but they didn't improve my current condition.
Have you had any significant health events or changes in your life around the time the spots first appeared or started spreading?
No, there were no significant health events or changes in my life around that time.
Final Diagnosis: Kaposi's sarcoma
